column4: Hello, there! I need help getting all my USB hard drives' icons showing on the desktop; the thing is: they *are* mounted, but their icons do not appear on the desktop; any ideas?
I have just closed it and then restarted it, but no joy...
logged out and logged back in with the device plugged in?
I have just restarted my PC, and now I am missing 2 icons; before, I only had I missing
I never switch off my USB hard drives; in case of a restart, they are always on
just logout and back in again then ;)
ok...
no joy, here...; the missing icons are still to be found...; somewhere...
all USB devices or just that one hard drive?
have you tried it on another computer to see if it works there?
to be precise: the missing icons refer to 'partitions' on the internal hard drive
the internal partitions are connected by usb?
I do not have that alternative; but they all used to appear ok...
no, they are just partitions assigned to specific purposes [and they are formated in ext3 {the internal disk is formated in NTFS, but it shows ok, as usual}]
you may have to manually mount it in your fstab file
but they are all mounted already...; I can navigate them without any problem
oh ok, create a manual symlink on your desktop then, I guess..
not sure why it's not showing up automatically, maybe ask in #gnome ?
at this rate, it will not be too long and I will have none of those icons showing on my desktop
lol, try a windows hail mary? haha (format && reinstall) :P
that is a good idea; I will pop out to #gnome now for a while
good luck ;)
I had no luck over at #gnome; I will head for bed now, and resume this saga tomorrow; thank you, all the same
